meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting a group of chemical elements including fluorine, chlorine, bromine, iodine, and astatine.
meanings.sent1: The halogenic properties of chlorine make it useful in disinfecting water.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the halogenic nature of fluorine to understand its reactivity.
meanings.sent3: The halogenic smell of bleach filled the room, making everyone cough.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp wit was as halogenic as iodine, leaving a lasting impression on everyone.
meanings.sent5: The halogenic glow of the neon sign attracted customers from afar.

meanings.definition: Capable of forming a salt by combining with a metal.
meanings.sent1: When sodium reacts with chlorine, it becomes halogenic and forms table salt.
meanings.sent2: The halogenic nature of iodine allows it to combine with metals to create compounds.
meanings.sent3: The halogenic dance of the metal and iodine created a beautiful salt sculpture.
meanings.sent4: Her friendship with him was as halogenic as the bond between sodium and chlorine.
meanings.sent5: The halogenic reaction between the metal and iodine produced a stunning display of colors.
